job_title: Student - Quality Analytics - Data and Analytics
job_description: <p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-size:10.0pt"><span><span style="font-family:Verdana, sans-serif"><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"> </span></span></p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-size:10.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><em><span>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.</span></em></span></span></p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"> </p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><b><span>Primary Location:</span></b><span> United States (US)</span><span> - Illinois</span><span> - Urbandale</span><span> <br><b>Function:</b> Data and Analytics (CA)</span><br><span><b>Title: </b>Part Time Student - Quality Analytics - Urbandale Or Ames, IA</span><span> - 116508</span> <br><b><span>Onsite/Remote:</span></b><span>Partial Remote Position</span></span></span></p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"> </p><p><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><b>Note: Relocation assistance is not provided.</b></span></span></p><p> </p><p><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><em>The Part-Time Student Program is primarily designed to augment the Company‚Äôs regular full-time staff and is for students who work in parallel to their school schedule <b>YEAR-ROUND</b>.</em></span></span></p><div><div style='padding: 10px 0px;border: 1px solid transparent;'><div style='font-size:16px;word-wrap: break-word;'><H2 style='font-size: 1em; margin: 0px'>Your Responsibilities</H2>&#13;</div><div><p> </p><p style="margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">As a <strong>Quality Analytics Part-Time Student</strong> for <span style="font-weight: bold;">John Deere Intelligent Solutions, </span>you will:</span></p><p style="margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 12.0pt;"> </p><p style="margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;" data-teams="true">Contribute to building internal data products that enhance machine quality and operational efficiency. This is a hands-on opportunity to work alongside engineers and data professionals, helping to shape tools that improve issue detection and prioritization for John Deere machines worldwide.</span></p><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;" data-teams="true"><span data-teams="true"><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong></span></span></p><ul><li><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;" data-teams="true"><span data-teams="true"><strong>Develop Data Products: </strong>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build and expand internal data tools that drive machine quality improvements.</span></span></li><li><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;" data-teams="true"><span data-teams="true"><strong>Feature Engineering with PySpark: </strong>Work primarily in Databricks using PySpark to create new features and enhance existing data products. Experience with Python, SQL, or PySpark is preferred, but you'll also gain valuable on-the-job training.</span></span></li><li><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;" data-teams="true"><span data-teams="true"><strong>Drive Innovation: </strong>Take ownership of tasks, explore data deeply, and propose creative solutions. We're looking for someone who is curious, proactive, and able to work independently while asking thoughtful questions when needed.</span></span></li></ul><p> </p><p style="margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 12.0pt;"><span style="font-weight: bold; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">This position is NOT available to students on immigration visas</span></p><p style="margin: 0in; font-family: Calibri; font-size: 12.0pt;"> </p></div></div><div style='padding: 10px 0px;border: 1px solid transparent;'><div style='font-size:16px;word-wrap: break-word;'><H2 style='font-size: 1em; margin: 0px'>What Skills You Need</H2>&#13;</div><div><p> </p><ul><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Proficiency with Python, SQL, or PySpark.</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for data.</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Self-motivated, inquisitive, and eager to learn.</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Pursuing a four-year college degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; others may apply</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Must be registered as a full-time student at an accredited local university</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Must be able to commute to the work location on a daily basis</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Graduation date of May 2027 or later</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Cumulative GPA of 2.8 or above</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">12 - 20 hours/week during the academic year</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">30 - 40 hours/week during the summer semester</span></li></ul></div></div><div style='padding: 10px 0px;border: 1px solid transparent;'><div style='font-size:16px;word-wrap: break-word;'><H2 style='font-size: 1em; margin: 0px'>What Makes You Stand Out</H2>&#13;</div><div><ul><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;" data-teams="true">Experience working in PySpark and Databricks</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;" data-teams="true">Experience with Github</span></li><li style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;" data-teams="true">Previous work in data analytics </span></li></ul></div></div></div><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive reward package to help you get started on your new career path, including:</span></span></span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Flexible work arrangements</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Highly competitive base pay and performance bonuses</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Savings &amp; Retirement benefits (401K and Defined Benefit Pension)</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Healthcare benefits with a generous company contribution in the Health Savings Account</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Adoption assistance</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Employee Assistance Programs</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Tuition assistance</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Charitable contribution match</span></span></span></li><li><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</span></span></span></li></ul><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-left:3.0px;margin-top:3.0px">$15 - $40 hourly based on published rates for business function and education level.</p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-left:3.0px;margin-top:3.0px"> </p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-left:3.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-size:12.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span>Follow this link to learn more about our Total Rewards Package <a href="https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL"><span style="color:blue">https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL</span></a> </span></span></span></p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"> </p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px">Must be 18 years of age or older to apply</p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"> </p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span style="font-size:10.0pt"><span style="font-size:7.0pt"><span>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.</span></span></span></span></p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"> </p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span style="font-size:10.0pt"><span style="font-size:7.0pt"><span>The terms of the applicable benefit plans, and all company actions administering or interpreting these plans, continue to control. Deere &amp; Company reserves the right to suspend, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan(s) in any manner at any time, including the right to modify or eliminate any cost-sharing between the company and participants. Changes, which can be made at any time, are made by action of the company's board of directors, or to the extent authorized by resolution of its board of directors, or by the Deere &amp; Company Compensation Committee. In the event of a conflict between the language of the official Plan Documents and this document, the language of the official Plan Documents will control.</span></span></span></span></p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"> </p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"> </p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><span style="font-size:10.0pt"><span style="font-size:7.0pt"><span>ACA Section 1557 Nondiscrimination Notice</span></span></span></span></p><p style="margin-bottom:1.0px;margin-top:3.0px"><span style="font-size:9.0px"><span style="font-family:Aptos, sans-serif"><em>The John Deere Health Benefit Plans for Salaried Employees and The John Deere Benefit Plan for Wage Employees comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.</em></span></span></p>

üöÄ Join the Future of Commerce with Whatnot! Whatnot is the largest live shopping platform in North America and Europe to buy, sell, and discover the things you love. We‚Äôre re-defining e-commerce by blending community, shopping, and entertainment into a community just for you. As a remote co-located team, we‚Äôre inspired by innovation and anchored in our values . With hubs in the US, UK, Germany, Ireland, and Poland, we‚Äôre building the future of online marketplaces ‚Äìtogether. From fashion, beauty, and electronics to collectibles like trading cards, comic books, and even live plants, our live auctions have something for everyone. And we‚Äôre just getting started! As one of the fastest growing marketplaces , we‚Äôre looking for bold, forward-thinking problem solvers across all functional areas. Check out the latest Whatnot updates on our news and engineering blogs and join us as we enable anyone to turn their passion into a business, and bring people together through commerce. üíª Role We are looking for intellectually curious, highly motivated individuals to join us for a 12-16 week hybrid internship during Summer 2026. Our interns work in cross-functional multidisciplinary teams enabling you to directly impact the direction of our platform. Your code and ideas will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges we face today and define future engineering initiatives. Some sample projects you might work on are: Building new features for users in our live-streams Implementing growth tactics and strategies to scale our buyer and seller flows Building systems at scale that help us deliver a high trust marketplace experience By the end of your internship, you will have contributed to one of the fastest growing marketplaces ever while gaining core industry skills of project ideation, management and collaboration. We offer flexibility to work from home or from one of our global office hubs, and we value in-person time for planning, problem-solving, and connection. Team members in this role must live within commuting distance of our New York City, Los Angeles, San Francisco or Seattle hub. üëã You Curious about who thrives at Whatnot? We‚Äôve found that embodying a low ego, growth mindset, and high-impact drive goes a long way here. As our next Engineering Intern you should have some industry software engineering experience, plus Pursuing a degree in computer science or other related major graduating in Dec 2026 or by Summer 2027 Problem solver and out-of-the-box thinker Willing to take risks and build product and systems for 1M+ users Ability to pick up on new technologies quickly üéÅ Benefits $150/month dogfooding budget We expect all employees to actively use the product! $150/month wifi/phone reimbursement üíõ EOE Whatnot is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, parental status, disability status, or any other status protected by local law. We believe that our work is better and our company culture is improved when we encourage, support, and respect the different skills and experiences represented within our workforce.
Join NTT Data in this exciting opportunity.

CompanyCox EnterprisesJob Family GroupBusiness OperationsJob ProfileIntern - TechnicalManagement LevelIndividual ContributorFlexible Work Option Hybrid - Ability to work remotely part of the weekTravel %Yes, 5% of the timeWork ShiftDayCompensationHourly base pay rate is $24.23 - $36.35/hour. The hourly base rate may vary within the anticipated range based on factors such as the ultimate location of the position and the selected candidate‚Äôs knowledge, skills, and abilities. Position may be eligible for additional compensation that may include commission (annual, monthly, etc.) and/or an incentive program.Job DescriptionWe encourage candidates to apply to no more than three internship opportunities within a 90-day period. Our recruiting team will review your application and ensure you are considered for the opportunities that best align with your skills and interests.¬†There‚Äôs something really inspiring about the idea of innovators teaming up to build something incredible. If you agree, then you might be a perfect fit for a tech job at Cox!¬†Across the Cox family of businesses (Cox Enterprises, Cox Communications and Cox Automotive), we‚Äôre looking for Data Analyst Interns to join our team and learn from the best. Ready to collaborate with us and work at a great company that truly cares about you and your future? Keep reading!¬†What‚Äôs In It For You?‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†We value your time and potential. At Cox, you‚Äôll be exposed to meaningful and challenging work.‚ÄØ¬†You won‚Äôt be left alone to figure things out. You‚Äôll have a team of supporters (plus an assigned program mentor) who will show you the ropes, guide you to excellence and cheer you on.¬†You‚Äôll experience real accountability to develop your professional skills.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†¬†You‚Äôll expand your network and professional toolbox through exposure to senior leaders.‚ÄØ¬†You‚Äôll help us build a bold future that is sustainable, accessible and inclusive.¬†¬†What you will do:¬†Learn how to develop data-driven insights.¬†Learn how to extract, transform, and load (ETL) the data for analysis.¬†Learn how to perform data cleansing, exploratory data analysis.¬†Learn how to work with different data sources to be able to produce the requested analysis.¬†Identify and utilize opportunities to increase efficiency and improve processes.¬†Influence critical business decision through analysis and visualization techniques.¬†¬†QUALIFICATIONS¬†Currently enrolled in a related degree program such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering majors¬†¬†Basic analytic skill.¬†Strong background in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Statistics.¬†Background using Microsoft tools mentioned above.¬†Detail oriented and able to meet project timelines through good time management and work prioritization.¬†Oral and written communications skills, as well as presentation skills.¬†A positive attitude, determination, and humility.¬†All STEM majors are encouraged to apply.¬†Intermediate to advance analytical skills.¬†Background or relevant coursework in any of the following areas: Mathematic, Statistics, Data Scientist, Computer and Information systems and Programming.¬†Ability to conduct thorough research and use the findings to inform decision making.¬†Python, PySpark, SQL or other coding and visualization skills are highly preferred.¬†¬†Don‚Äôt miss out on the first steps toward your future. Apply today!‚ÄØ¬†¬†Intern/Co-Op sessions are considered temporary employment. No full-time employment commitments are made. However, depending on our business needs, some interns may be considered for a full-time position following the conclusion of the session conditioned upon the intern graduating from their academic program and being available to commence full-time employment at a specified time.¬†¬†Applicants must currently be authorized to work in the United States for any employer without current or future sponsorship.‚ÄØ¬†¬†BenefitsBenefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page.About UsAs our primary divisions Cox Automotive and Cox Communications drive new waves of innovation, Cox Enterprises is entering spaces like cleantech, healthcare, esports and more. We're a family business guided by a legacy of bold innovation that‚Äôs driven by those who want to make their mark. Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page. Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer ‚Äì All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual‚Äôs age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law. Cox provides reasonable accommodations when requested by a qualified applicant or employee with disability, unless such accommodations would cause an undue hardship.Applicants must currently be authorized to work in the United States for any employer without current or future sponsorship. No OPT, CPT, STEM/OPT or visa sponsorship now or in future.

Application Deadline: March 13th 2026, 11:59pm ESTProgram Overview VideoCastleton Commodities International is an independent global commodities merchant. As a trader, CCI deploys capital on a proprietary basis in the physical and financial commodity markets, providing the Company with market insights and access. As a strategic investor and developer, CCI leverages its market expertise, operations capabilities, and industry knowledge to invest in, and develop, select commodity infrastructure assets. CCI focuses its activities on the markets it understands best, while constantly striving to expand its knowledge base and network of relationships in order to participate in new markets.Position Overview:¬†CCI is developing a leading-edge Data Science platform, as staying at the forefront of data management and analytics is essential to our investment strategy. We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Generative AI Intern to join our Global Data Science team in Houston, TX to support our Generative AI projects. The ideal candidate will have a solid technical background, a strong interest in commodities markets, and a passion for Data Science and AI. This internship provides a unique opportunity to gain practical experience in creating generative AI tools, work collaboratively with diverse teams, and contribute to projects with substantial commercial influence.Responsibilities:Assist in the development and execution of a strategic roadmap for integrating generative AI technologies into the firm's trading operations.Collaborate with analysts and technologists to support the delivery of AI-driven projects.Contribute to ensuring the scalability, reliability, and robustness of generative AI tools in a production environment.Architect Multi-Agent Systems: Collaborate on the design of multi-agent systems where specialized agents work together to solve complex, cross-domain problems.Participate in managing projects, data cataloging, and metadata for the Generative AI initiative.Work closely with traders, analysts, and other stakeholders to translate business needs into technical solutions.Communicate complex AI concepts and outcomes to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.Stay up to date on the latest advancements in generative AI, identifying opportunities for innovation.Qualifications:Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science or a related field.Expected graduation date of Winter 2026 or Spring/Summer 2027Hands-on experience with agentic AI frameworks (e.g., evolved versions of LangChain, LlamaIndex, Crew AI, etc.) for building tool-using, planning agents.Proficiency with Python & SQL programming.Demonstrated experience of context engineering, with a deep understanding of techniques like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), advanced function calling, and model orchestration.Familiarity with building and integrating APIs or MCPs.Familiarity with the architecture of AI systems, including the role of vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate) in providing long-term memory and context for agents.Excellent algorithmic problem-solving skills, with the ability to design systems that can navigate ambiguity.A strong sense of intellectual curiosity and a demonstrated passion for building the future of AI.Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Visit ¬†https://www.cci.com/careers/life-at-cci/# to learn more!

Program DescriptionThe Technology Rotational Development Program is an eighteen-month program consisting of rotations with various technology teams supporting all aspects of our investment process, including research, portfolio management, trading, investment data, investor account management. As a member of the program, you will be introduced to a wide range of technologies, systems and processes critical to the firm‚Äôs success. You will also have the opportunity to participate in networking events with senior leadership to learn more about the firm‚Äôs history, culture and values.In the first few weeks of employment, you and your cohort will attend introductory sessions led by our technology leaders. The leaders provide an overview of their team, technology stack and opportunities within their respective teams for you and your fellow rotational employees to consider.¬† After the conclusion of those introductory sessions, you will commence the rotation portion of the program and receive role-specific training and exposure to all aspects of software design, development and deployment. You will also gain a valuable understanding of investment data processing techniques, data modeling, scalable computing environments, analytics, and high-performance system design using AWS services. Arrowstreet leverages both Windows and Linux platforms, allowing for exposure to a wide range of technologies, including Spark, Python, C#, SQL and JavaScript/Typescript, in addition to all of the underlying AWS technologies that we leverage to take advantage of elasticity and scalability of cloud deployments. Upon conclusion of the Technology Rotational Development Program, you will have the opportunity to join a team that closely aligns with your skills and interests.QualificationsA bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering, information technology, mathematics, data science, or electrical engineering upon graduation in May/June 2026. Demonstrated academic success and achievement.Applied technology experience through prior internships and academic projects.Demonstrated interest in a software engineering career path and programming experienceAbility to thrive in a fast-paced environmentStrong communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skillsMotivation, curiosity, enthusiasm, and passion for technologyThe base salary range for this position is $100,000 - $125,000 per year.Arrowstreet Capital operates a robust talent acquisition program, and we also seek to compensate and reward our employees competitively within our industry and in line with our merit-based culture.‚ÄØOur approach to total compensation includes base salaries and annual discretionary bonuses, as well as a robust benefits package. The determination of a successful candidate‚Äôs base salary placement within the listed range will vary based on the candidate‚Äôs relevant experience and qualifications (which may also include relevant certifications, credentials and other education), the job responsibilities and scope, the commensurate resulting level of the position and other relevant factors. The listed range is also an estimate, and additional information regarding base salary and other elements of total compensation offered by Arrowstreet Capital to successful applicants will be communicated during the recruitment process.¬†¬†Arrowstreet Capital is a Boston-based systematic investment firm that manages global equity portfolios for institutional investors around the world. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, genetic information, age, pregnancy, medical condition, disability, veteran or military status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.Arrowstreet Capital is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process due to a disability, contact us to discuss the nature of your request and contact information.

University, Data ScientistThe Opportunity:‚ÄØAre you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data‚ÄØopen-up‚ÄØnew opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global issues. Across private and public sectors from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence, you know the answers are in the data.‚ÄØ¬†We have an opportunity for you to use your analytical skills to improve our business. You‚Äôll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You‚Äôll apply analytical skills and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into tangible answers to help clients make informed decisions. You‚Äôll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good.Join us. The world can‚Äôt wait.‚ÄØ¬†You Have:‚ÄØ¬†Experience with machine learning, data mining, statistics, or graph algorithms in academic or internship environmentsExperience using R, Perl, Python, SAS, or SPSS for data analysisExperience in data gathering and analytical workKnowledge of an object-oriented language, including Java, C++, C#, or PythonAbility to obtain a Secret clearanceScheduled to obtain a Bachelor's degree by Spring 2026 or Summer 2026Nice If You Have:‚ÄØ¬†Possession of excellent problem-solving skillsScheduled to obtain a Master‚Äôs degree in CS, Data Science, Computer Engineering, Systems Engineering, or a related field by Spring 2026Clearance:‚ÄØ¬†Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.CompensationAt Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen‚Äôs benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual‚Äôs particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $62,000.00 to $141,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.Identity StatementAs part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.Work ModelOur people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you‚Äôll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.If this position is listed as onsite, you‚Äôll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.Commitment to Non-DiscriminationAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.
